channel.title: The Hodljuice Daily Pint
channel.itunes:author: curated by Hodljuice
channel.description: Daily collection of various Bitcoin-related podcasts

item.title: Access Tribes Bitcoin Podcast: AT77 - Jill Ford, Bitcoin for Incarcerated Women
item.itunes:author: Access Tribes Bitcoin Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin education, incarceration, financial empowerment, risks of fiat currency
item.description: Jill Ford shares her unique journey in the Bitcoin mining industry, stemming from her personal experiences with fiat currency while incarcerated. She advocates for educating others about Bitcoin and sound money, aiming to empower individuals to make informed financial choices. Jill strives to help particularly those affected by the fiat system, encouraging knowledge as a tool for financial independence.

item.title: Bitcoin for Millennials: How Bitcoin Startups Are Changing the Game | Mike Jarmuz | BFM098
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for Millennials
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin startups, investment strategies, Bitcoin adoption, future of technology
item.description: Mike Jarmuz discusses the role of Bitcoin startups in the investment landscape, emphasizing early-stage investing and funding strategies for founders. He highlights the current state of Bitcoin adoption and the evolution of Lightning Ventures, while exploring the future potential of Bitcoin companies across various industries. The conversation addresses challenges and opportunities in Bitcoin investing and the regulatory landscape's impact on growth.

item.title: Coin Stories: Lyn Alden on Bitcoin Price Jump & Future of Bitcoin: Navigating Forks, Risks, & Institutional Impact
item.itunes:author: Coin Stories
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin consensus, institutional investment, Bitcoin forks, market risks
item.description: Lyn Alden discusses Bitcoin consensus, the risks linked to network fragmentation, and the influence of institutional investors on Bitcoin's future. She emphasizes the importance of education within the community regarding these complex dynamics and reviews the implications of recent events like Bitcoin's price reaching all-time highs. Together with her co-authors, she provides insights from their research on Bitcoin consensus and its associated risks.

item.title: Fractal Bitcoin: Bitcoin ATH melting faces approaching $90K LFG!!! Governments front running?
item.itunes:author: Fractal Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin price movement, government policies, market implications, bullish sentiment
item.description: This episode highlights Bitcoin's recent surge in price as it approaches an all-time high, while analysts predict potential increases up to $1 million. The discussion also critiques government monetary policies, with optimism conveyed through Bernstein research urging purchases of Bitcoin and crypto investments. The insights provided reflect on the dynamic relationship between Bitcoin and global political landscapes.

item.title: POD256 Mining News: 057. From Sweden to Silicon: Bitcoin's Global Journey
item.itunes:author: POD256 Mining News
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin community, mining innovations, political landscape, collaborative projects
item.description: Recorded live, this episode features discussions about Bitcoin mining, community engagement, and innovative projects like the Ember One aimed at accessible mining. It includes personal stories from guests and humor regarding the current Bitcoin price debate, while also reflecting on political influences on cryptocurrency. The episode emphasizes collaboration and the community spirit driving the Bitcoin ecosystem forward.

item.title: Pleb Underground: Trumps Real Bitcoin Agenda Exposed! | Guest: BitcoinShooter | EP 111
item.itunes:author: Pleb Underground
item.itunes:keywords: Trump presidency, Bitcoin influence, storytelling in Bitcoin, market trends
item.description: BitcoinShooter joins to discuss his upcoming project while exploring the controversial link between the Trump presidency and Bitcoin. The conversation touches on how Bitcoin affects global conflicts, storytelling's role in the cryptocurrency narrative, and market trends related to political figures. The episode reflects on the implications of Trump's influence on the Bitcoin landscape and upcoming events.

item.title: Robin Seyer: AVOID Costly Mistakes! The BEST Way to Keep Your BTC Safe
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyer
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin self-custody, security practices, wallet management, educational insights
item.description: This episode emphasizes the importance of self-custody for Bitcoin owners, as Robin Seyer discusses various security strategies including multi-signature and UTXO management. With practical takeaways, they highlight the necessity for users to understand their wallets to safeguard their investments effectively. Education is noted as a crucial factor in overcoming fears associated with self-custody.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: BITCOIN BREAKS ALL TIME HIGH - What's Next? | EP 1116
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin price surge, market speculation, future prospects, bull market
item.description: This episode celebrates Bitcoin reaching an all-time high, surpassing $84,000, and discusses the potential for continued growth in the market. The hosts speculate on the implications of this bullish trend for the upcoming year, highlighting the significance of this development for Bitcoin's future prospects.

item.title: Stephan Livera Podcast: Shaping Bitcoin's Future in UK with Freddie New SLP614
item.itunes:author: Stephan Livera Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin regulation, UK policy, custodianship, political engagement
item.description: Freddie New discusses the evolution of Bitcoin regulation in the UK, including challenges from the Financial Conduct Authority and recent policy shifts recognizing Bitcoin as property. He stresses the importance of engaging with politicians to foster a Bitcoin-friendly regulatory environment. The episode also covers issues such as fraud concerns impacting banking access and the potential for renewable energy in Bitcoin mining.

item.title: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast: #555: How Trump Will Serve The CBDC Agenda with Whitney Webb & Mark Goodwin
item.itunes:author: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Trump policies, CBDC implications, Bitcoin influence, political narratives
item.description: A discussion with Whitney Webb and Mark Goodwin reveals insights into Trump's connections to centralized digital currencies and the implications for Bitcoin. Key topics include the Trump coalition's dynamics, stablecoins, and the overall influence of politicians on crypto policies. The conversation scrutinizes the narrative around Trump as a supposed savior within the Bitcoin community.

item.title: The Bible and Bitcoin Podcast: Trump, the Great Awakening and the Refounding of America W/ The Based Boomer
item.itunes:author: The Bible and Bitcoin Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Great Awakening, faith and finance, Bitcoin advantages, community building
item.description: This episode discusses the Great Awakening's implications for America, emphasizing the need for financial freedom and the negative effects of fiat currency. The hosts underscore the importance of community and education in navigating faith and finance discussions, advocating for Bitcoin as a solution to societal issues.

item.title: The Breakdown: The Present and Future of Crypto-Based Prediction Markets
item.itunes:author: The Breakdown
item.itunes:keywords: Prediction markets, decentralized finance, market trends, technological advancements
item.description: This episode explores the rise of crypto-based prediction markets, discussing their operation and potential impact on traditional markets. Insights center on decentralized finance's role in their growth and various application areas. The conversation highlights present trends, challenges, and opportunities in this evolving sector.

item.title: The Bugle Weekly: Selection Autopsy | Bugle Weekly Episode 34
item.itunes:author: The Bugle Weekly
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin news, cryptocurrency developments, market implications, recent updates
item.description: The hosts cover the most significant Bitcoin news from the past week, providing updates on notable developments in the cryptocurrency market. The discussion aims to keep Bitcoin enthusiasts informed about the implications these updates may have for the future of Bitcoin.

item.title: The Davani Connection: TDC #243: POWER ANALYSIS OF BITCOIN - with JAMES CHECK
item.itunes:author: The Davani Connection
item.itunes:keywords: On-chain data analysis, Bitcoin market conditions, investor psychology, expert insights
item.description: James Check provides expert insights into Bitcoin's on-chain data, merging data interpretation with an understanding of investor psychology to analyze market conditions. This episode serves as an in-depth discussion of the factors influencing Bitcoin's price and market behavior, offering listeners a nuanced perspective on current trends.

item.title: This Week in Bitcoin: Why the Market is High on Bitcoin
item.itunes:author: This Week in Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin market surge, ETF developments, investing strategies, market implications
item.description: The episode examines the factors contributing to the recent surge in Bitcoin prices and its impact on stock markets. It discusses the growth in assets within US spot Bitcoin ETFs and their significance. Additionally, the hosts cover recent Bitcoin-related developments and their implications for investors' strategies moving forward.

item.title: Token Metrics Daily Podcast: Crypto Bull SZN is live! ARE YOU IN?
item.itunes:author: Token Metrics Daily Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Crypto market trends, Solana performance, legal battles in crypto, market excitement
item.description: This episode highlights the excitement surrounding the crypto market's recent performance, noting a consistent six-day surge. The hosts discuss Solana's remarkable rise to a significant market cap and touch on the ongoing legal challenges faced by FTX. The tone is optimistic, reflecting the current bullish sentiment in the market.

item.title: Bitcoin and Markets: ETF Options Approval and Central Bankers Attack Bitcoin With Nonsense - E410
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin and Markets
item.itunes:keywords: [ETF options, Central banking rhetoric, Macroeconomic analysis, Importance of research]
item.description: This episode discusses ETF options approval and strategies used by central bankers to undermine Bitcoin. It analyzes macroeconomic factors affecting Bitcoin and critiques traditional financial institutions' rhetoric. The episode stresses the importance of conducting independent research amidst financial misinformation.

item.title: Bitcoin Audible: Chat 117-Bitcoin Threat Vectors on Final Settlement
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Audible
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin custody, Security challenges, Multisig setups, Personal security incident]
item.description: This episode covers Bitcoin custodial threat vectors and the unique security challenges associated with it. Insights from a personal security incident highlight the real risks faced by Bitcoin holders. The discussion includes the evolution of custody solutions and the importance of multisig setups for securing assets.

item.title: BTC Sessions: WHY ARE WE BULLISH? David Branscum, Aladdin (BTC Cards), Nathan Fitzsimmons (The BTC Mentor) ep251
item.itunes:author: BTC Sessions
item.itunes:keywords: [Bullish sentiment, Investment strategies, Self-custody, Hardware wallets]
item.description: This episode features a discussion on the bullish sentiment surrounding Bitcoin, focusing on investment strategies and self-custody. Guests share their experiences with hardware wallets and the implications of Bitcoin's market behavior. The conversation emphasizes the importance of privacy and secure engagement with Bitcoin.

item.title: Coin Stories: 'News Block: Bitcoin Enters Price Discovery After Trump Win, Fed Cuts Rates Again, Bond Yields Rise Amid Inflation Fears'
item.itunes:author: Coin Stories
item.itunes:keywords: [Price discovery, Political impact, Institutional adoption, Economic trends]
item.description: This episode covers critical news affecting Bitcoin, including its record highs following Trump's re-election and pro-crypto candidates winning congressional seats. It also discusses the Federal Reserve's rate cuts and their implications for Bitcoin alongside institutional adoption trends. The episode analyzes investment movements and Bitcoin's current economic environment.

item.title: Fractal Bitcoin: Bitcoin 3rd day all-time highs! $420K in 2025?! Global FOMO incoming! - Ep.217
item.itunes:author: Fractal Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: [Price discovery, ETF growth, Historical comparisons, Government adoption]
item.description: This episode highlights Bitcoin's recent price activity, suggesting an ambitious price projection of $420,000 by 2025 amid a surge in ETF assets. It compares Bitcoin's adoption to the internet's growth and discusses significant developments in municipal acceptance of cryptocurrencies for tax payments. Noteworthy events include record purchases by Bitcoin ETFs.

item.title: Onramp Media: 'The Last Trade E073: The Orange Wave with Larry Lepard & David Foley'
item.itunes:author: Onramp Media
item.itunes:keywords: [Election impact, Bitcoin reserves, Monetary policy, Institutional strategies]
item.description: This episode discusses the intersection of Bitcoin and upcoming election dynamics, emphasizing the potential for a pro-Bitcoin administration. Topics include the idea of a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve and the role of sound assets in todayâ€™s economy. The discussion includes market insights and comparisons between Bitcoin and gold.

item.title: Pleb Underground: Bitcoin Mining CRISIS On The Horizon?
item.itunes:author: Pleb Underground
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin mining crisis, Cost implications, Resource allocation, Profitability concerns]
item.description: This episode explores a looming crisis in Bitcoin mining as operational costs rise and profits decline. Hosts discuss resource shifts towards AI and the financial viability of Bitcoin mining operations. The discussion provides insights into current trends and challenges faced by miners in the cryptocurrency landscape.

item.title: Robin Seyer: 'Trillion-Dollar BTC Bet: Microstrategy Soon Biggest Firm in the world?'
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyer
item.itunes:keywords: [MicroStrategy's Bitcoin strategy, Future of finance, Bitcoin as a commodity, Educational accessibility]
item.description: Tim Kotzman discusses Bitcoin's transformative potential through MicroStrategy's significant investments, suggesting it could evolve into a trillion-dollar entity. The episode highlights Bitcoin as a commodity and emphasizes the need for accessible channels for engaging with cryptocurrency. It positions MicroStrategy at the forefront of Bitcoin's integration into the broader economy.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: 'BREAKING: Central Banker EXPOSED In BOMBSHELL Interview | EP 1115'
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: [Central banking policies, Monetary implications, Financial landscape, Inflation]
item.description: This episode discusses controversial remarks made by Jerome Powell concerning central banking practices and their ramifications for the economy. The analysis focuses on the future of digital currencies and the implications of monetary policies on Bitcoin and inflationary concerns. This disclosure is contextualized against current economic challenges.

item.title: Swan Signal Live A Bitcoin Show: Is This the Start of a Super Cycle?
item.itunes:author: Swan Signal Live A Bitcoin Show
item.itunes:keywords: [Market trends, Policy impact, Government support, Price projections]
item.description: The discussion revolves around Bitcoin's performance following Trump's election, with a focus on potential new price highs and the possibility of a "super cycle." It examines expected government policies favorable to Bitcoin, including potential strategic reserves. The episode captures a sense of optimism about Bitcoin's mainstream acceptance.

item.title: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast: '#554: UAP Disclosure Is Upon Us with Matt Pines'
item.itunes:author: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: [UAP disclosure, Bitcoin policy, Supranational institutions, Geopolitical insight]
item.description: This episode with Matt Pines discusses the potential inclusion of Bitcoin in Trump's policy amidst an impending UAP disclosure. It covers the evolution of supranational financial institutions, American geopolitical power, and the implications of technology in current defense strategies. Key insights highlight the intersections between these areas and Bitcoin's future.

item.title: The Mark Moss Show: China Fires A Monetary Bazooka... Will It Be Enough?
item.itunes:author: The Mark Moss Show
item.itunes:keywords: [China's financial strategy, Global market impact, Bitcoin implications, Investment strategies]
item.description: Analyzing China's dramatic financial maneuvers, this episode questions the potential effects on global markets, including U.S. stocks and Bitcoin. Historical insights into past economic strategies provide context for current events. The discussion emphasizes the need for investment positioning in the wake of these developments.

item.title: The Transformation of Value: What is Nuclear Energy with Nick Touran
item.itunes:author: The Transformation of Value
item.itunes:keywords: [Nuclear energy, Political challenges, Economic implications, Regulatory landscape]
item.description: This episode features a discussion with nuclear engineer Nick Touran about the challenges and opportunities facing the nuclear energy sector. The conversation covers the history of nuclear energy, its current regulatory issues, and the outlook for future technology in energy production and abundance.

item.title: The What is Money Show: Can Trump Save the West? Freedom, Peterson vs. Dawkins, COVID & Bitcoin w/ Bret Weinstein (WiM529)
item.itunes:author: The What is Money Show
item.itunes:keywords: [Incentives in evolution, Libertarianism, Technology in academia, Freedom vs. tyranny]
item.description: Dr. Bret Weinstein discusses the interplay of incentives in evolution and the relevance of Libertarianism to contemporary society, along with the potential impacts of Trump on freedom and governance. The dialogue explores major cultural debates, including the discourse surrounding COVID-19 mandates and their implications for societal values.

item.title: Token Metrics Daily Podcast: Rate Down, Crypto Up, BTC TaxðŸ“Š
item.itunes:author: Token Metrics Daily Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: [Fed rate decision, Crypto market response, Urban crypto adoption, Timeliness of information]
item.description: This episode discusses the positive response of the crypto market to the US Federal Reserve's rate decision, alongside a focus on a US city significantly embracing cryptocurrency. The conversation highlights the role of crypto in improving public awareness of financial events.
